The burn ban issued for Walker County on Jan. 18 was lifted Monday following a conference between Huntsville Fire Chief Tom Grisham and Walker County Judge Danny Pierce.
With the discontinuation of the burn ban, all Walker County residents will now be allowed to conduct outdoor burns.
“Grisham and Pierce met today and lifted the burn ban on county, so anybody in the county is allowed to burn,” said Jason January with the Huntsville Fire Department.

Residents of Huntsville will be able to pick up a burning permit — which is mandatory for city residents who plan to burn — at either of the city’s fire stations, January said.
January said the burning permits, which are free to the public, will allow the permit holders to burn for 60 days.
